title: Straw Man
excerpt: Anda salah menggambarkan argumen seseorang untuk mempermudah menyerang argumennya
excerpt_en: You misrepresented someone's argument to make it easier to attack.
description: Dengan membesar-besarkan, salah mengartikan, atau hanya mengarang-ngarang argumen seseorang, jauh lebih mudah untuk menyatakan posisi Anda sendiri sebagai sesuatu yang masuk akal, tetapi ketidakjujuran semacam ini berfungsi untuk melemahkan debat rasional yang jujur.;
description_en: By exaggerating, misrepresenting, or just completely fabricating someone's argument, it's much easier to present your own position as being reasonable, but this kind of dishonesty serves to undermine honest rational debate.
example: After Will said that we should put more money into health and education, Warren responded by saying that he was surprised that Will hates our country so much that he wants to leave it defenceless by cutting military spending.

title: False Cause
excerpt: You presumed that a real or perceived relationship between things means that one is the cause of the other.
description: Many people confuse correlation (things happening together or in sequence) for causation (that one thing actually causes the other to happen). Sometimes correlation is coincidental, or it may be attributable to a common cause.
example: Pointing to a fancy chart, Roger shows how temperatures have been rising over the past few centuries, whilst at the same time the numbers of pirates have been decreasing; thus pirates cool the world and global warming is a hoax.
